Mathematics.ieb_flexibility: Schools can design innovative problem-solving tasks and real-world applications within the 25% SBA allocation
notes: Emphasis on mathematical reasoning and problem-solving

English.ieb_flexibility: Schools can choose literature texts and design creative writing tasks that suit their context
notes: Strong emphasis on critical analysis and original thinking
Oral component includes prepared and impromptu tasks

Physical_Sciences.ieb_flexibility: Schools can design additional practical investigations beyond standard PATs
notes: Practical work emphasizes scientific method and inquiry
Strong focus on experimental design and analysis

Life_Sciences.ieb_flexibility: Schools can incorporate field work, research projects, and contemporary biological issues
notes: Research projects often involve current scientific topics
Practical work includes both lab and field investigations

Accounting.ieb_flexibility: Schools can use real business case studies and contemporary accounting scenarios
notes: Projects often involve analysis of real company financial statements
Case studies connect theory to business practice

Mathematical_Literacy.ieb_flexibility: Schools can design investigations using local data and real-world contexts
notes: Strong emphasis on practical applications and data analysis
Investigations often use authentic local contexts

key_differences_from_caps.assessment_weighting: IDENTICAL - Both IEB and CAPS use 25% SBA + 75% Final Exam
key_differences_from_caps.flexibility: IEB allows schools more creativity in designing SBA components within the 25% allocation
key_differences_from_caps.innovation: IEB encourages innovative, rigorous assessments that go beyond minimum requirements
key_differences_from_caps.school_autonomy: Individual IEB schools can adapt assessment methods to their educational philosophy
key_differences_from_caps.quality_assurance: IEB provides guidelines but trusts schools to maintain high standards

common_misconceptions.myth: IEB uses 60% continuous assessment + 40% final exam
common_misconceptions.reality: IEB follows the same 25% SBA + 75% final exam weighting as CAPS
common_misconceptions.clarification: The 60/40 split applies only to Further Studies programmes, not regular NSC subjects

common_misconceptions.myth: IEB is easier because of more continuous assessment
common_misconceptions.reality: IEB has the same assessment weighting but often more rigorous SBA tasks
common_misconceptions.clarification: IEB schools typically set higher standards within the 25% SBA component

flexibility_notes: IEB aligns with CAPS weighting (25% SBA, 75% final exam) but allows schools some flexibility in designing SBA components within guidelines. Emphasis on rigorous, innovative assessments.
advantages_of_ieb_approach: Schools can design SBA tasks that match their educational philosophy
More innovative and creative assessment methods encouraged
Real-world applications and contemporary issues can be incorporated
Teachers have professional autonomy within IEB guidelines
Assessment tasks often more engaging and relevant to students

university_preparation.continuous_assessment_skills: IEB students often better prepared for university-style ongoing assessment
university_preparation.critical_thinking: SBA tasks emphasize analysis, evaluation, and original thinking
university_preparation.research_skills: Projects and investigations develop independent research abilities
university_preparation.time_management: Balanced assessment load teaches effective time management

quality_assurance.moderation: IEB moderates SBA tasks to ensure consistency across schools
quality_assurance.guidelines: Clear assessment guidelines provided while allowing creativity
quality_assurance.teacher_training: IEB provides ongoing professional development for teachers
quality_assurance.school_visits: Regular quality assurance visits to maintain standards
